us.phonetic: /v. ˌoʊvɚˈloʊd, n. ˈoʊvɚˌloʊd/, (v. ō′vər lōd′; n. ō′vər lōd′)

example.eg: Mark overloaded the wheelbarrow and then couldn't lift it.
example.egtrans: 马克在独轮车上装载了太多东西，推都推不动。

example.eg: The high volume of calls overloaded the system and it broke down.
example.egtrans: 大量的来电使系统超负荷，出了故障。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使负担过重, 使超负荷

dsense.name: overload [sb] with [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative (too much information) (比喻，如信息、知识等)

example.eg: Bill is a good teacher, but he tends to overload his students with information.
example.egtrans: 比尔是位好老师，但他总喜欢塞给学生太多信息。

dsense.name: overload
dsense.guideword: (electrical power surge) (比喻电流需求超出装置的极限)

example.eg: The power cut was caused by an overload.
example.egtrans: 停电是因超负荷用电引起的。

us.phonetic: /v. ˌoʊvɚˈloʊd, n. ˈoʊvɚˌloʊd/, (v. ō′vər lōd′; n. ō′vər lōd′)

example.eg: Lindsay was struggling under an overload of work.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 过量, 过重, 过多

example.eg: The circuits overloaded and the power went off.
The power tripped because you overloaded the circuits.

us.phonetic: /v. ˌoʊvɚˈloʊd, n. ˈoʊvɚˌloʊd/, (v. ō′vər lōd′; n. ō′vər lōd′)
